Posts.Title: Trying not to freak out Golfnut33 Golfnut33

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2018 09:34PM - edited Oct 16, 2018 09:48PM by Golfnut33 hi all First of 25 radiation treatments today. Cancer centre is 1 hours drive away so called before leaving to check that on time -all was good but when I arrived there was a 90 minute delay! Was also given a schedule for next week but 5 out of 7 times were way outside of the ranges I gave. Radiologist said to just come when I could but that doesn't feel right and am sure receptionists won't agree ... On the verge of refusing further treatment as I don't see who would have the time to waste 4+ hours a day on it - when exactly can I work? On top of that a headache all afternoon and feel very hot

Posts.Title: ADH Club Chickenpants SarBar22

Posts.Content: Golfnut33 wrote: Soooo I went for a mammogram 2 weeks ago and then was given a 3D mammogram followed by an ultrasound. Last mammogram 2015 which required a fine needle biopsy for a cyst. Got an urgent phone call from my doctor on Tuesday to come in that day to see her. All she told me was that concentrated calcifications were found so she had booked my biopsy for Tuesday and sent a referral to a breast surgeon for me. Haven't seen any reports but compared to last experience this all seems a lot more serious. Can I ask at biopsy for more information? Will they give it to me? Am trying to stay calm over the weekend but this seems an unusually cruel way of dealing with people! I have apparently very dense breasts so I am assuming that makes it all harder. I am in Ontario Canada so undoubtedly that makes the whole thing more complex .... Dx 4/2018, LCIS/DCIS, Right, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Trying not to freak out Golfnut33 Golfnut33

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2018 10:25AM Golfnut33 wrote: thank you egads007!  So to update, I got to hospital to be advised my biopsy was cancelled as the incorrect kind was booked (biopsy with us when I needed a stereotactic). This has now been booked for April 11 with a follow up with breast surgeon on April 23. I did however manage to get a copy of my mammogram and ultrasound report which notes 'on mammogram the breast parenchyma is dense. In the upper right breast there are calcification a of indeterminate appearance which are oriented in the linear distribution' BIRAD4 was assigned. So luckily it is not a birad5 but such a pain having to wait so long now
Posts.Title: Trying not to freak out Golfnut33 Golfnut33

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2018 02:46PM Golfnut33 wrote: B-A-P why don’t you request a copy of your pathology from the biopsy. You are entitled to this and it will give you more information about margins etc. My surgeon is very brusque and distant but she did at least give me a copy of my report and explained some key things in it
Posts.Title: DCIS - just diagnosed B-A-P B-A-P

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2018 08:26AM Golfnut33 wrote: hi all - I started rads in October - now done 14 with 11 more to go - seems never ending and unlike most of you, I am fairly resentful about the whole thing .... currently taking 2.5 to 3 hours a day despite having a set time but do have 50 mins travel each way - usually in the dark and rain. Pretty burnt now so using a saline compress and have been advised to use otc hydrocortisone cream and polysporin for any open wounds that may develop. Hope you all continue to do well and remain positive
